[[Princesa Yamal]] | music = Herminio Gutiérrez | cinematography = María José Cuevas
[[Mark Powell (photographer)|Mark Powell]] | editing = Ximena Cuevas | distributor = CinePantera
Detalle Films | released = {{Film date|2016|09|12|Toronto|2016|11|26|México}} | runtime = 93 minutes | country = Mexico | language = Spanish | budget = | gross = }} '''''Beauties of the Night''''' (in Spanish '''''Bellas de noche''''') is a 2016 Mexican [[documentary film]]. It is the first production of the filmmaker María José Cuevas. The film shows a glimpse of the glory, sunset and resurgence of five of the main showgirls ([[Vedette (cabaret)|vedettes]]) that triumphed in Mexico in the decades of the 1970s and 1980s. ==Plot== They were the ''Queens of the Night'' in late-night [[Mexico]] in the 1970s and 1980s. The names of the great ''[[Vedette (cabaret)|Vedette]]s'' illuminated the streets of [[Mexico City]] from the awnings of the great nightclubs, cabarets and theaters of the capital. But time passed. Nightlife changed in Mexico. New types of entertainment replaced them and the big ''vedettes'' seemed to have been forgotten. Today, more than thirty years of its splendor in the nightlife of Mexico, ''Beauties of the Night'' explores the lives of five of the main vedettes of the golden years: [[Olga Breeskin]], [[Lyn May]], [[Rossy Mendoza]], [[Wanda Seux]] and [[Princesa Yamal]]. The film shows the viewer a deeper facet of the current life of these five vedettes. Women who, despite the years and having taken their life to the extreme, are full of life and with an enviable physical condition. Not only have they managed to reinvent themselves and survive in the entertainment world, but also in life itself. Between laughter and tears, the film reflects the passage of years, emotions and personal challenges for the lives of each of these women[http://www.gatopardo.com/portafolio/medios/bellas-de-noche/ ''Gatopardo: Beauties of the Night, Ladies of the Mexican Pop Culture''] ==Cast== * [[Olga Breeskin]] * [[Lyn May]] * [[Rossy Mendoza]] * [[Wanda Seux]] * [[Princesa Yamal]] ==Production== The title of the documentary evokes the film ''[[Bellas de noche]]'', the first film of the so-called [[Mexican sex comedy|Cine de ficheras]], which dates back to 1975. The idea of Cuevas to pay homage to these women arises from her childhood. Cuevas, daughter of the prestigious Mexican artist [[José Luis Cuevas]], had contact with several of these women, who were friends of her father. Years later, Cuevas had a meeting with Princesa Yamal, who performed an Arab dance in front of her, giving her the idea of producing this documentary, whose realization lasted for a decade.[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IWcQETCFBEQ ''Beauties of the Night: Press conference in YouTube''] The film delivers an exercise in which the contrasts of time come to light and unveils what lies behind the stardom. You can appreciate an honest, dynamic and effective exercise in which remains the curiosity to know more details. Although the documentary came from the idea of paying homage to these women, the relationship between them and the filmmaker María José Cuevas, became so close that they became a family.[http://www.gatopardo.com/portafolio/medios/bellas-de-noche/ ''Gatopardo: Beauties of the Night, Ladies of the Mexican Pop Culture''] ==Awards== ===[[Morelia International Film Festival]]=== * Best Mexican Documentary * Best Mexican Documentary realized by a woman * Best Mexican Feature film ===[[Los Cabos International Film Festival]]=== * Audience Award for a Mexican Documentary film ===Mexico City Awards=== * Best Film ===Panama International Film Festival=== * Best Documentary film ===[[Ariel Award]]=== * Best Film (Nominated) * Best Mexican Documentary Film (Nominated) * Best Edition (Nominated) * Best First Production (Nominated) ===Other=== * [[International Documentary Film Festival Amsterdam]] - Official Selection.[https://www.idfa.nl/industry/tags/project.aspx?id=93749C88-73B3-4A9C-8AF6-F00EACDE0C0C ''Beauties of the Night in International Documentary Film Festival Amsterdam''] * [[Toronto Film Festival]] - Official Selection[http://www.tiff.net/films/beauties-of-the-night ''Beauties of the Night Review in the Toronto Film Festival''] * [[Telluride Film Festival]] - Official Selection[http://www.telluridefilmfestival.org/news ''Beauties of the Night in the Telluride Film Festival list''] * Cartagena of Indias International Film Festival - Official Selection[http://www.ficcifestival.com/pelicula.php?p=XG3C6fwm4KJn9egB1nwASvgCXG3C6fwm ''Festival Internacional de Cine de Cartagena de Indias: Beaties of the Night''] * [[Palm Springs International Film Festival]] - Official selection[https://www.psfilmfest.org/2017-ps-film-festival/films/beauties-of-the-night ''Palm Springs International Film Festival: Beauties of the Night''] * [[Buenos Aires International Festival of Independent Cinema]] - Official Selection[http://festivales.buenosaires.gob.ar/2017/bafici/index.xhtml?pagename=movie%26movie.exhibitiontitle%3DBellas+de+noche ''BAFICI 2017: Beauties of the Night''] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * {{IMDb title|4958426}} * [https://es-la.facebook.com/bellasdenochedocumental/ ''Official Facebook''] * [https://twitter.com/bellasdenoche_ ''Official Twitter''] * [http://ambulante.com.mx/es/mas/documental/bellas-de-noche ''Beauties of the Night in Ambulante.com''] * [https://vimeo.com/158426034 ''Official Trailer''] * [http://www.tiff.net/films/beauties-of-the-night ''Beauties of the Night Review in the Toronto Film Festival''] * [https://www.idfa.nl/industry/tags/project.aspx?id=93749C88-73B3-4A9C-8AF6-F00EACDE0C0C ''Beauties of the Night in International Documentary Film Festival Amsterdam''] {{DEFAULTSORT:Beauties of the Night (documental)}} [[Category:Vedettes (cabaret)]] [[Category:2016 films]] [[Category:2010s documentary films]] [[Category:Mexican films]] [[Category:Mexican documentary films]] [[Category:Spanish-language films]]

{{EngvarB|date=April 2014}} {{Use dmy dates|date=April 2014}} {{Infobox film | name = Billa II The Beginning | image = Billa 2 release poster.jog.jpg | caption = Theatrical release poster | director = [[Chakri Toleti]] | producer = Sunir Kheterpal
[[Suresh Balaje]]
George Pius | writer = Jaffer Mohammed
E. R. Murugan
'''(Dialogue)''' | story = Chakri Toleti
[[Eric Felberg]]
Sarath Mandava | screenplay = Chakri Toleti
Sarath Mandava
Jaffer Mohammed | starring = [[Ajith Kumar]]
[[Parvathy Omanakuttan]]
[[Bruna Abdullah]]
[[Vidyut Jammwal]]
[[Rohit Khurana]]
[[Sudhanshu Pandey]] | music = [[Yuvan Shankar Raja]] | cinematography = [[R. D. Rajasekhar]] | editing = [[Suresh Urs]] | studio = Wide Angle Creations
[[Hinduja Group|IN Entertainment]] | distributor = [[Aascar Films]] (India)
GK Media (USA) | released = {{Film Date|2012|07|13|df=y}}{{cite web|url=http://www.indiaglitz.com/channels/tamil/article/83166.html|title='Billa 2' from July 13| work=Indiaglitz| date=25 June 2012| accessdate=4 July 2012 }} | runtime = 132 minutes | language = Tamil | country = India | budget = {{INR}}35 crore{{cite web|url=http://www.behindwoods.com/tamil-movies-cinema-articles/45-for-Enthiran-17-for-Billa-2-18-07-12.html|title=Billa 2 Ajith's costliest|publisher=Behindwoods.com|accessdate=25 April 2013}} | gross = }} '''''Billa II: The Beginning''''' is a 2012 Indian Tamil-language [[Action film|action thriller]][http://www.bbfc.co.uk/releases/billa-2 BILLA 2: BBFC] film directed by [[Chakri Toleti]]. It is a prequel to ''[[Billa (2007 film)|Billa]]'' (2007) and focuses on how David, an ordinary man from the coastal regions of South Tamil Nadu, becomes Billa, a dreaded underworld don, with [[Ajith Kumar]] reprising the role of the titular character.{{cite web|url=http://www.indiaglitz.com/channels/tamil/article/66818.html|title=Billa 2's plot revealed|publisher=IndiaGlitz|accessdate=28 January 2012}} [[Parvathy Omanakuttan]], [[Bruna Abdullah]], [[Vidyut Jammwal]] and [[Sudhanshu Pandey]] appear in supporting roles, all of them marking their debut in Tamil cinema. The film's soundtrack and background score were composed by [[Yuvan Shankar Raja]], while [[R. D. Rajasekhar]] handled the cinematography and [[Suresh Urs]] worked as the editor. The film, produced by Wide Angle Creations in association with the [[Hinduja Group]] company IN Entertainment, was officially announced in November 2010, with [[Vishnuvardhan (director)|Vishnuvardhan]] as the director. Due to schedule clashes, Vishnuvardhan was replaced by Chakri Toleti, with a new script having been penned by a team involving Toleti, Sarath Mandava and Eric Felberg. Principal photography happened between July 2011 and December 2011. The filming primarily took place at [[Tamil Nadu]], Goa, [[Hyderabad, India|Hyderabad]] and in [[Georgia (country)|Georgia]]. ''Billa II'' was released worldwide on 13 July 2012 and a dubbed Telugu version titled ''David Billa'' was also simultaneously released in [[Andhra Pradesh]].{{cite web|url=http://www.sify.com/movies/billa-2-to-release-wide-in-foreign-languages-news-tamil-mg0jN1dcgjg.html?scategory=tamil|title=Billa 2 to release wide in foreign languages!|publisher=Sify|date=26 June 2012|accessdate=13 July 2012}} The film received above average to positive reviews and did a decent business at box office. ==Plot== {{long plot|date=February 2013}} David Billa ([[Ajith Kumar]]), a [[Sri Lankan Tamil]] refugee along with several others, arrives at the town of [[Rameswaram]] in boat. After being interrogated by an arrogant civil servant, he is let into the refugee camp where he befriends Ranjith ([[Yog Japee]]). Billa makes his presence felt, when he slaps Muthu (Theepatti Ganesh), one of the rogue workers around, for making a derogatory comment. The refugee camp is constantly terrorised by corrupt police officer Raghubir Sinha ([[Krishna Kumar (actor)|Krishna Kumar]]). After witnessing the brutal murder of one of the inmates at his hands, Billa attacks Raghubir when he tries to forcefully detain one of his friends. Raghubir then gets Billa tortured in prison and vows to make him suffer. A few days later, Muthu calls Billa and Ranjith aside and promises them work. Billa and Ranjith are hired to transport fish from Rameswaram to Chennai. But unknown to them, the truck they were driving had diamonds inside, and Raghubir had alerted his men on the highway to catch them red-handed. As per the plot, they get caught in the check post, and after realising what had happened, Billa kills all the cops and drive the truck to its destination. Here they meet Selvaraj ([[Ilavarasu]]), who is pleased by Billa's loyalty and includes him in his businesses. Billa gets back and murders Raghubir and the civil servant. He then goes to meet his elder sister ([[Janaki Sabesh]]) and niece Jasmine ([[Parvathy Omanakuttan]]) in a church. When they see his gun, they realise he is involved in crime. Not knowing what to say, Billa simply walks away. Kotiswara Rao ([[Manoj K. Jayan]]) visits Selvaraj and asks him if he could help in selling off the heroin he had brought along with him. Billa volunteers to sell it off on a 5% commission in exchange. He sets off and delivers the heroin to a local thug who refuses to pay for it in return. In a brutal scuffle that ensues where one of Billa's friends is slaughtered, Billa takes out the thug and his men and returns with the money and heroin. Soon, Billa meets Koti's boss Abbasi ([[Sudhanshu Pandey]]), who is very impressed by the former and recruits him. After a party held at his club, he receives a phone call from the Russian mafia led by Dimitri ([[Vidyut Jamwal]]), telling him that his arms consignment has been held by the Indian coastal guards and he asks for his help. Billa and Ranjith retrieve the consignment for him and are congratulated by Dimitri for their work. Soon, Billa learns his sister died and brings Jasmine with him to live in a big villa in Goa. Jasmine displays her feelings for him, but Billa does not reciprocate and is instead more concerned at her education and safety. Billa and Koti travel to Russia to meet Dimitri, who happens to own an arms and ammunition manufacturing unit with Koti, where he signs a deal with Dimitri without Abbasi's knowledge in presence of Jagdish ([[Rahman (actor)|Rahman]]), a corrupt Interpol officer helping these underworld criminals. Abbasi learns of this from Koti, and is furious at Billa's daring and disobedient behaviour. Tensions further increase when Billa beats up Satish Kumar ([[Rohit Khurana]]), the son of an influential minister Praveen Kumar ([[Dinesh Lamba]]), when he tries to misbehave with Jasmine in a party. Abbasi expresses his discontent and vents at him. Billa, surprised and enraged at his ingratitude, walks away with Ranjith. Billa, Ranjith, and Ram (Sarath Mandava) plot to venture into the drug business on their own during the carnival. At the carnival, Billa is betrayed by Ram and is brutally attacked. However, he survives, finishes off the assailants, kills Abbasi and Ram, and becomes the most powerful crime lord, extending his business without any boundaries. He also ropes in Abbasi's girlfriend Sameera ([[Bruna Abdullah]]), much to Jasmine's displeasure. Dimitri arrives into the scene and tries to negotiate a deal with Billa. But Billa refuses for his low payment, and angered by his defiance and rebellion, Dimitri seeks to oust him. Dimitri seeks out the help of Koti, Satish, and Praveen to eliminate David. They proceed to kill Chief Minister Mohan Kanth ([[Madhusudhan Rao (actor)|Madhusudhan Rao]]), and the blame falls upon Billa. However, Billa is freed, and Koti kidnaps Jasmine, who is found in a field, tied up and her mouth gagged with duct tape. Billa rescues her and informs Sameera to come to a church to take Jasmine away to Malaysia for safety. But Sameera conspires against them and the goons, with the minister's son, arrive at the church and hold Billa and Jasmine captives. Billa, stabbed, is held to the ground and is mocked at by Satish, who slits Jasmine's throat. Unable to witness her death, Billa overpowers everyone and kills all the goons. This is the scene at which the film initially starts. Meanwhile, in Russia, Dimitri is having an auction of his weapons, and Koti is present with him. He shows his factory in his computer via a series of webcams and much to everyone's shock, Billa is seen destroying his factory in Georgia. He also sees his delivery train go off course. Angered with fear, he kills Koti for not killing Billa, and he sets out himself to finish the task. The arms factory is destroyed by Billa and his friends. Dimitri arrives and follows his delivery train, when to his shock, the delivery train is blown by Billa, who would be waiting for him on his own helicopter. After an intense battle, Billa kills Dimitri. In the concluding scene, Billa and Ranjith boards a plane, and the former's goons (Sameera, Police and Lawyer) are eliminated by Billa. ==Cast== {{colbegin}} * [[Ajith Kumar]] as David Billa * [[Parvathy Omanakuttan]] as Jasmine * [[Bruna Abdullah]] as Sameera * [[Sudhanshu Pandey]] as Abbasi * [[Vidyut Jammwal]] as Dimitri * [[Yog Japee]] as Ranjith * [[Manoj K. Jayan]] as Kotiswara Rao * [[Ilavarasu]] as Selvaraj * [[Rahman (actor)|Rahman]] as Jagdish * [[Sricharan (actor)|Sricharan]] as Bobby * [[Krishna Kumar (actor)|Krishna Kumar]] as Raghubir Sinha * [[Sriman (actor)|Sriman]] as Lawyer * [[Madhusudhan Rao (actor)|Madhusudhan Rao]] as Chief Minister Mohan Kanth * [[Janaki Sabesh]] as David Billa's sister * Byron Gibson as Russian Mafia Boss * [[Rohit Khurana]] as Satish Kumar * [[Dinesh Lamba]] as Praveen Kumar * [[Ashok Selvan]] as young Billa (photograph only){{cite web|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/tamil/movies/did-you-know-/Ashok-Selvans-picture-was-featured-in-Billa-2/articleshow/46986564.cms|title=Ashok Selvan's picture was featured in Billa 2 - Times of India|publisher=|accessdate=30 September 2016}} * Ron Smoorenburg as Russian Martial Artist * Sarath Mandava as Ram * Theepatti Ganesh as Muthu * Ashok Bentwal * [[Yuvan Shankar Raja]] as special appearance * [[Meenakshi Dixit]] special appearance in item number "Madurai Ponnu" * [[Nicole Amy Madell]] special appearance in item number "Yedho Mayakkam" and "Gangster" * [[Gabriela Bertante]] special appearance in item number "Yedho Mayakkam" {{colend}} ==Production== ===Development=== In 2008, reports claimed that [[Soundarya Rajinikanth]] was planning to make a follow-up after noting ''[[Billa (2007 film)|Billa]]''{{'}}s commercial success, to be produced by [[Ocher Studios]] in association with [[Warner Bros.]]{{cite web|url=http://www.behindwoods.com/tamil-movie-news-1/may-08-01/billa-07-05-08.html|title=Will Ajith do Billa – 2 ?|publisher=Behindwoods|accessdate=16 September 2011}}{{cite web|url=http://entertainment.oneindia.in/tamil/exclusive/2008/soundarya-rajinikanth-billa-2-190508.html|title=Soundarya Rajini confirms Billa-2|publisher=Oneindia.in|date=19 May 2008|accessdate=16 September 2011}} However, the sequel did not materialise and the idea was dropped, with Ajith Kumar, Vishnuvardhan and Soundarya getting busy with other projects. In 2010, sources confirmed that Vishnuvardhan had finished penning the script for a prequel, which would star Ajith Kumar as the titular character again,{{cite web|title=BREAKING NEWS: AJITH'S BILLA 2|publisher=Behindwoods|url=http://www.behindwoods.com/tamil-movie-news-1/jul-10-05/ajith-vishnuvardhan-billa-28-07-10.html|year=|accessdate=28 July 2010}} and would commence in 2011.{{cite web|author=Moviebuzz|title=Vishnuvardhan to make Billa prequel!|publisher=Sify|url=http://sify.com/movies/tamil/fullstory.php?id=14951341|year=2010|accessdate=29 July 2010}} The project became officially announced in late 2010, after Ajith Kumar signed up to the prequel and first production poster were published to the media.{{cite web|title=It's official: Ajith signs 'Billa II'|publisher=IndiaGlitz|url=http://www.indiaglitz.com/channels/tamil/article/61364.html|year=2010|accessdate=4 November 2010}}{{cite web|author=Moviebuzz|title=Breaking News- Billa 2 confirmed|publisher=Sify|url=http://sify.com/movies/breaking-news-billa-2-confirmed-news-tamil-klel6kcbgfc.html|year=2010|accessdate=4 November 2010}} Further details were disclosed, with [[Suresh Balaje]], son of producer and actor K. Balaji, who produced the original ''Billa'' with Rajinikanth, and George Pius from Wide Angle Creations banner, being confirmed as the producer, who would associate with Mumbai-based IN Entertainment Limited, a [[Hinduja Group|Hinduja group company]].{{cite web|url=http://www.indiainfoline.com/Markets/News/IN-Entertainment-ties-up-with-Wide-Angle-Creations/5071125059|title=IN Entertainment ties up with Wide Angle Creations|publisher=Indiainfoline.com|date=1 February 2011|accessdate=16 September 2011}} The entire production team of the ''Billa'' remake, including cinematographer [[Nirav Shah]], editor [[A. Sreekar Prasad]] and music director [[Yuvan Shankar Raja]], were announced to be retained for the sequel.{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2011-02-02/news-interviews/28372663_1_vishnu-telugu-film-heroine|title=Vishnuvardhan's double dhamaka|work=The Times of India|date=2 February 2011|accessdate=16 September 2011}} In a turn of events, [[Vishnuvardhan (director)|Vishnuvardhan]] opted out of the project citing that his dates clashed with the making of his Telugu film, ''[[Panjaa]]'' (earlier titled as ''The Shadow'').{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2011-02-18/news-interviews/28614918_1_director-vishnuvardhan-venkat-prabhu-directed-mankatha-film|title=Vishnu cancels billa date|work=The Times of India|date= 18 February 2011|accessdate=16 September 2011}} [[Chakri Toleti]] who directed the 2009 [[Kamal Haasan]]-[[Mohanlal]] starrer ''[[Unnaipol Oruvan (2009 film)|Unnaipol Oruvan]]'' was subsequently signed on by the producers to direct the venture.{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2011-02-22/news-interviews/28624795_1_ajith-billa-thala|title=Ajith gets new script, director for Billa 2|work=The Times of India|date=22 February 2011|accessdate=16 September 2011}} In May 2011, Chakri Toleti held his first press conference stating that production would begin in late June 2011 and revealing that "''Billa 2'' would focus on how David, an ordinary man from the coastal [[Thoothukudi]] in South Tamil Nadu, becomes Billa, a dreaded underworld don".{{cite web|url=http://www.sify.com/movies/billa-2-to-start-by-june-end-news-kollywood-lfsoQhdhgia.html|title=Billa 2 to start by June end|publisher=Sify|date=18 May 2011|accessdate=16 September 2011}} David's character was afterwards widely reported to be either a refugee from [[Tamil Eelam]] or a Tamilian from [[Sri Lanka]].{{cite web|url=http://www.indiaglitz.com/channels/tamil/article/70525.html|title=How does Ajith become a don in 'Billa 2'?|publisher=IndiaGlitz|date=|accessdate=28 March 2012}}{{cite web|url=http://ibnlive.in.com/news/ajith-not-a-sri-lankan-refugee-in-billa-ii/239098-62-128.html|title='Billa II': Ajith not playing Sri Lankan refugee|work= [[CNN-IBN]]|date=|accessdate=28 March 2012}} Both the director and the producer refused to confirm the statements, disclosing only that the film would depict David's journey over a period of five years.{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2012-03-13/news-interviews/31158865_1_billa-thala-ajith-death-defying-stunts|title=Death-defying stunts, Ajith style!|work=The Times of India|date=13 March 2012|accessdate=28 March 2012}} With Vishnuvardhan's exit from the project, his script was also scrapped, and Toleti along with Ajith Kumar began penning a new script for the prequel. Yuvan Shankar Raja only was retained from the original production team,{{cite web|url=http://www.indiaglitz.com/channels/tamil/article/64393.html|title='Billa 2': Yuvan on board|publisher=IndiaGlitz|accessdate=16 September 2011}} with the rest of the technical crew being finalised in the following weeks.{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2011-03-02/news-interviews/28646721_1_mankatha-ajith-billa|title=Ajith bonding with Yuvan|work=The Times of India|date=2 March 2011|accessdate=16 September 2011}} [[Hemant Chaturvedi]], who hitherto had worked in [[Bollywood]] productions only, was signed on to replace [[Nirav Shah]] as the cinematographer after the latter's schedules clashed with the making of his other film, ''[[Vettai]]''.{{cite web|url=http://www.sify.com/movies/hemant-chaturvedi-is-billa-2-cameraman-news-tamil-lehlhliadcd.html|title=Hemant Chaturvedi is Billa 2, cameraman|publisher=Sify|accessdate=16 September 2011}} However, in July 2011, Hemant Chaturvedi too moved out of the project, fearing that the delay in commencement of ''Billa 2'' may hurt his chances in Bollywood, and [[R. D. Rajasekhar]] was appointed as the new cinematographer.{{cite web|title=Who moved out of Billa 2 now?|publisher=Behindwoods|accessdate=8 July 2011|url=http://www.behindwoods.com/tamil-movie-news-1/jul-11-02/ajith-billa-2-08-07-11.html}} V. Selvakumar who had notably worked in ''[[Madrasapattinam]]'' was selected as the art director.{{cite web|url=http://www.indiaglitz.com/channels/tamil/article/68543.html|title='Billa 2' starts rolling|publisher=IndiaGlitz|accessdate=16 September 2011}} The crew also announced that the film would become the first Indian production to be filmed with an [[Red Digital Cinema Camera Company|RED EPIC Camera]], being shot at 5K resolution.{{cite web|url=http://behindwoods.com/tamil-movie-news-1/jul-11-01/billa-2-ajith-05-07-11.html|title=Billa-2 and the James Cameron Connection|publisher=Behindwoods|date=5 July 2011|accessdate=16 September 2011}} Writer Ee. Raa. Murugan, who had previously collaborated with Chakri Toleti in the [[Kamal Hassan]]-starrer ''Unnaipol Oruvan'', was appointed to write the dialogue. ===Casting=== From the previous film, the producers made it clear that apart from [[Ajith Kumar]],{{cite web|url=http://www.indiaglitz.com/channels/tamil/article/66737.html|title=Ajith's new look in 'Billa 2'|publisher=IndiaGlitz|accessdate=16 September 2011}} and [[Rahman (actor)|Rahman]], most of the other characters would not be retained. The female lead role was expected to be handed to [[Anushka Shetty]], but despite media speculation she was not signed on.{{cite web|url=http://www.sify.com/movies/will-anushka-sign-billa-2-opposite-ajit-news-tamil-lb1ufQdjjhj.html|title=Will Anushka sign Billa-2 opposite Ajit?|publisher=Sify|accessdate=16 September 2011}}{{cite web|url=http://www.sify.com/movies/most-wanted-anushka-news-tamil-lcmlAiabeah.html|title=Most Wanted- Anushka|publisher=Sify|date=12 February 2011|accessdate=16 September 2011}} The female lead role was handed to debutant [[Huma Qureshi (actress)|Huma Qureshi]], a Mumbai-based theatre actor who had previously been featured in commercials, with Toleti finalising Qureshi after a nationwide search for an actress.{{cite web|url=http://www.indianexpress.com/news/Huma-Qureshi-opposite-Ajit-in-Billa-2/785737/|title=Huma Qureshi opposite Ajit in Billa 2|work=The Indian Express |accessdate=16 September 2011}}{{cite web|url=http://www.rediff.com/movies/report/south-first-look-ajiths-new-heroine/20110412.htm|title=Meet Ajith's new heroine|publisher=Rediff|date=12 April 2011|accessdate=16 September 2011}}{{cite web|url=http://www.indiaglitz.com/channels/tamil/article/65678.html|title=Billa 2 to bring on fresh beauty|publisher=IndiaGlitz|accessdate=16 September 2011}} However, she was removed from the project by September 2011, due to date clashes,{{cite news| url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2011-09-10/news-interviews/30138845_1_billa-ajith-50th-film|work=The Times of India | title=Huma Qureshi out of Billa 2?| date=10 September 2011}} and became replaced by [[Miss India World]] 2008 [[Parvathy Omanakuttan]] later that month,{{cite web|url=http://www.moviecrow.com/News/97/parvathy-omnakuttan-to-pair-with-ajith|title=Parvathy Omnakuttan to pair with Ajith|publisher=|accessdate=30 September 2016}}{{cite web|url=http://www.sify.com/movies/parvathy-is-ajiths-heroine-in-billa-2-news-tamil-lj3j5degaba.html|title=Parvathy is Ajiths heroine in Billa-2|publisher=Sify|date=29 September 2011|accessdate=29 September 2011}} who the director had spotted and offered the role of Jasmine at a fashion show.{{cite news|author=Jiji Ann Cherian|url=http://www.deccanchronicle.com/tabloid/kochi/bowled-over-billa-935|title=Bowled over by Billa|work=Deccan Chronicle|date=6 April 2012|accessdate=17 April 2012}} Parvathy described her character as a "simple girl who transforms into a modern person" and that Billa looks up to, adding that she was had more scenes in the "emotional part" of the film.{{cite web|url=http://www.ndtv.com/article/view/regional/158051?device=iphone|title=Parvathy Omanakuttan signs Billa 2|work = [[NDTV]]|date=15 December 2011|accessdate=28 March 2012}} Bollywood actress and model [[Bruna Abdullah]] was selected to portray another significant character,{{cite web|url=http://www.rediff.com/movies/report/miss-world-runner-up-in-billa-two/20111018.htm|title=Miss World runner-up in Billa 2|publisher=Rediff|date=18 October 2011|accessdate=17 December 2011}} which she went on term as "super powerful, very strong and sexy".{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2011-12-21/news-interviews/30542105_1_billa-ajith-chakri-toleti|title=I'm here to stay: Bruna Abdullah|work=The Times of India|date=21 December 2011|accessdate=28 March 2012}} Besides models Abdullah, and Parvathy Omanakuttan, [[Meenakshi Dixit]] was recruited for the item number "Madurai Ponnu". Another three models including, [[Gabriela Bertante]], [[Nicole Amy Madell]], and an unknown artist, was recruited to perform a dance number "Yedho Mayakkam".{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2012-04-08/news-interviews/31305238_1_billa-ajith-chakri-toleti|title=Brazilian model for Ajith|work=The Times of India|date=8 April 2012|accessdate=17 April 2012}}{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2012-06-17/news-interviews/32269934_1_ajith-dancing-tamil-film|title=Billa II's Oomph factor!|publisher=[[The Times of India]]|date=17 June 2012|accessdate=17 June 2012}} Television actor [[Krishna Kumar (actor)|Krishna Kumar]], was signed on to play a "dirty cop".{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2011-04-09/news-interviews/29397248_1_malayalam-film-kk-three-films|title=Krishnakumar is a happy man|work=The Times of India|date= 9 April 2011|accessdate=16 September 2011}} In June 2011, [[Sudhanshu Pandey]], a former model who has appeared in several Hindi films, was given the role of a "greying ganglord", who becomes the mentor to the young David,{{cite web|url=http://www.indianexpress.com/news/sudhanshu-pandey-plays-a-baddie-in-billa-2/885449/0|title=Sudhanshu Pandey plays a baddie in Billa 2|work=The Indian Express|date=9 December 2011|accessdate=28 March 2012}} whilst Malayalam character actor [[Manoj K. Jayan]] was roped in for a "key role".{{cite web|url=http://www.sify.com/movies/ajiths-7-million-billa-2-starts-rolling-news-tamil-lhorF9ecfia.html|title=Ajith's $7 million Billa 2 starts rolling|publisher=Sify.com|accessdate=16 September 2011}} Actress [[Vimala Raman]] was signed on to make a special appearance in the film,{{cite web|author= Anupama Subramanian|url=http://www.deccanchronicle.com/channels/showbiz/kollywood/vimala-raman-enters-bollywood-078|title=Vimala Raman enters Bollywood|work=Deccan Chronicle |date=2 July 2011|accessdate=16 September 2011}}{{cite web|url=http://www.indiaglitz.com/channels/tamil/article/66818.html|title='Billa 2's plot revealed|publisher=IndiaGlitz|accessdate=16 September 2011}} however she opted out in July 2011 citing date problems.{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2011-07-13/news-interviews/29768327_1_billa-tamil-film-vimala-raman|title=Vimala says no to Billa 2|work=The Times of India|date=13 July 2011|accessdate=16 September 2011}} [[Meenakshi Dixit]] was later finalised for that role and shot her scenes in July 2011 during the first schedule.{{cite news| url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2011-11-16/news-interviews/30410671_1_billa-girl-flick|work=The Times of India | title=Meenaxi Dixit: Item girl for Billa 2| date=16 November 2011}} [[Vidyut Jamwal]], who played negative roles in the Hindi film ''[[Force (2011 film)|Force]]'' (2011) and the Telugu film ''[[Oosaravelli]]'' (2011), was selected to play the villain, also making his debut in Tamil cinema.{{cite news| url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2011-11-14/news-interviews/30402013_1_billa-ajith-martial-arts|work=The Times of India | title=Vidyut takes on Ajith| date=14 November 2011}} In December 2011 sources revealed that [[Sricharan (actor)|Sricharan]], who starred in ''[[Payanam]]'', was shooting for a supporting role in the film.{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2011-12-03/news-interviews/30471298_1_sricharan-tehran-flight|title=Sricharan's dramatic airport experience|work=The Times of India |date=3 December 2011|accessdate=18 December 2011}} Reports in February 2012 suggested that the team was trying to sign [[Nayantara]], who played the female lead in ''Billa'', for a [[cameo role]];{{cite web|author=Anupama Subramanian|url=http://www.deccanchronicle.com/channels/showbiz/kollywood/nayanthara-%E2%80%99s-cameo-billa-2-006|title=Nayanthara 's cameo in Billa 2|work=Deccan Chronicle |date=26 February 2012|accessdate=11 March 2012}} the actress refuted the rumours.{{cite web|url=http://www.behindwoods.com/tamil-movie-news-1/feb-12-04/ajith-nayan-27-02-12.html|title=Nayanthara Denies Ajith Rumors|publisher=Behindwoods|date=27 February 2012|accessdate=11 March 2012}} Furthermore, composer [[Yuvan Shankar Raja]] on Toleti's insistence agreed to make a brief appearance in one of the songs.{{cite news|author=Janani Karthik|url=http://www.deccanchronicle.com/channels/showbiz/kollywood/yuvan-dances-billa-2-050|title=Yuvan dances in Billa 2|publisher=Deccan Chronicle|date=16 April 2012|accessdate=17 April 2012}} Sources also reported that director [[Sebastian Seeman|Seeman]] would be acting in the film.{{citation needed|date=July 2012}} ===Filming=== The film's production was delayed as Ajith Kumar's previous film, ''[[Mankatha]]'', progressed beyond the anticipated completion dates. In March 2011, the producers released a press note that the film would begin in early May 2011, however this failed to happen.{{cite web|url=http://www.sify.com/movies/billa-2-press-release-news-tamil-ldbjoSbaije.html|title=Billa 2 – Press Release|publisher=Sify|accessdate=16 September 2011}} During that period, it was also suggested that ''Billa II'' may not be Ajith Kumar's successive project and commence only after the actor completed a film with [[M. Raja]].{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2011-04-20/news-interviews/29459707_1_billa-50th-film-mankatha-thala|title=Billa 2 isn't Ajith's 51sth film!|work=The Times of India|date=20 April 2011|accessdate=28 March 2012}} Eventually, a photo shoot was held in June 2011 with Ajith sporting an appearance of a man in his mid-twenties.{{cite web|url=http://www.behindwoods.com/tamil-movie-news-1/jun-11-04/ajith-billa-2-24-06-11.html|title=Ajith's Look in Billa 2!|publisher=Behindwoods|date=24 June 2011|accessdate=16 September 2011}} [[Principal photography]] commenced on 14 July 2011 at the [[Ramoji Film City]] in [[Hyderabad, India|Hyderabad]]. Filming during the first 30-day schedule throughout July and August 2011 was held in Hyderabad and [[Visakhapatnam|Vizag]]. As part of the schedule, one song was shot in [[Puducherry]] under the direction of choreographer [[Raju Sundaram]].{{cite web|author=Prakash K. L.|url=http://entertainment.oneindia.in/tamil/news/2011/ajith-shoots-foot-tapping-billa-300811.html|title=Ajith shoots foot-tapping number for Billa|publisher=Oneindia.in|date=30 August 2011|accessdate=28 March 2012}} Both actresses Parvathy Omanakuttan and Bruna Abdullah joined the crew for the second schedule in [[Goa]],{{cite web|url=http://www.indiaglitz.com/channels/tamil/article/70435.html|title=Ajith's 'Billa 2' status quo|publisher=IndiaGlitz|date=|accessdate=28 March 2012}} that lasted for 39 days and ended in the first week of November.{{cite web|url=http://www.rediff.com/movies/report/meet-the-villian-of-ajiths-billa-two/20111117.htm|title=Meet the villian of Ajith's Billa 2|publisher=Rediff|date=17 November 2011|accessdate=17 December 2011}} In the third week of November, a unit of thirty-six members left for [[Georgia (country)|Georgia]] in Eastern Europe for the final 20-day schedule of the film.{{cite web|url=http://www.sify.com/movies/billa-2-goa-schedule-complete-news-tamil-llfkmHceidd.html|title=Billa 2, Goa schedule complete|publisher=[[Sify]]|date=6 November 2011|accessdate=17 December 2011}} In Georgia, the crew filmed at the country's capital, [[Tbilisi]], [[Borjomi]] and [[Rustavi]].{{cite news| url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2011-12-19/news-interviews/30533751_1_shot-shooting-songs|work=The Times of India | title=K-Town goes to Europe| date=19 December 2011}} ''Billa II'' became the first Indian film to be shot at the [[Likani|Likani Palace]], which functions as a summer residence of the [[President of Georgia]].{{cite web|url=http://www.sify.com/movies/snowfall-play-games-on-the-sets-of-billa-2-news-tamil-mf4of4bhjaj.html?ref=false|title=Snowfall play games on the sets of Billa-2|publisher=Sify|date=30 May 2012|accessdate=13 July 2012}} Midway through the filming, heavy snowfall began. The crew, however, carried on shooting and later reshot the complete sequence with the snowy background to maintain the continuity.{{cite web|url=http://www.behindwoods.com/tamil-movie-news-1/may-12-05/billa-2-ajith-30-05-12.html|title=Billa 2 Was Shot at Likani Palace|publisher=Behindwoods|date=30 May 2012|accessdate=13 July 2012}} The climax portions were also filmed there against a snowy backdrop, for which [[aerial shot]]s were done from a helicopter.{{cite web|author=Janani Karthik|url=http://www.deccanchronicle.com/channels/showbiz/kollywood/billa-2-done-967|title=Billa 2 is done!|publisher=''Deccan Chronicle''|date=19 December 2011|accessdate=28 March 2012}} Approximately half a million dollars were spent for the whole schedule in Georgia,{{cite web|url=http://www.investingeorgia.org/?107/1732/|title=Billa-2 First "Bollywood" movie is shot in Georgia|publisher=Invest in Georgia|date=|accessdate=28 March 2012}} which was finished by mid-December.{{cite news|url=http://www.behindwoods.com/tamil-movie-news-1/dec-11-03/ajith-billa-2-20-12-11.html|title=Billa 2 wrapped up|publisher=Behindwoods|accessdate=20 December 2011}} In February 2012, the remaining scenes, including the film's title song,{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2012-02-18/news-interviews/31074689_1_billa-chakri-toleti-51st-film|title=Billa 2 title song finally shot!|publisher=''The Times of India''|date=18 February 2012|accessdate=28 March 2012}}{{cite web|url=http://www.sify.com/movies/billa-2-title-song-picturised-news-tamil-mctmocicbae.html?ref=false|title=Billa 2 title song picturised|publisher=Sify|date=19 February 2012|accessdate=28 March 2012}} were canned at the [[Ramoji Film City]] in [[Hyderabad, India|Hyderabad]],{{cite web|url=http://www.sify.com/movies/billa-2-makes-brisk-progress-news-tamil-mcqlVwagfeb.html?ref=false|title=Billa 2 makes brisk progress|publisher=Sify|date=16 February 2012|accessdate=17 April 2012}} despite the ongoing strike in the film industry.{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2012-02-16/news-interviews/31066307_1_billa-chakri-toleti-strike|title=Billa 2 shoot despite strike|publisher=''The Times of India''|date=16 February 2012|accessdate=28 March 2012}} An [[item number]] "Yedo Mayakkam" featuring three models was shot in a studio in Goa.{{cite web|url=http://www.indiaglitz.com/channels/tamil/article/80649.html|title=Ajith to shake a leg with Gabriela Bertante!|publisher=IndiaGlitz|date=9 April 2012|accessdate=17 April 2012}} Although producer Kheterpal had named [[Bangkok]], Thailand as a potential location for filming,{{cite news|url=http://www.filmbiz.asia/news/billa-2-is-big-budget-bet-for-tamil-films|title=Billa 2 is big budget bet for Tamil films| publisher=Filmbiz.asia|date=14 July 2011|accessdate=16 September 2011}} shooting was not held there. The entire filming was completed over a period of 90 days.{{cite news|url=http://www.deccanchronicle.com/channels/showbiz/kollywood/billa-2-done-967|work=Deccan Chronicle|accessdate=20 December 2011|title=Billa 2 is done!}} Three stunt choreographers were involved in the making of ''Billa II''. The stunt sequences in Georgia were partly choreographed by an award-winning German-based company led by stuntman Stefan Richter,{{cite news|author=K. R. Manigandan|url=http://www.thehindu.com/life-and-style/metroplus/article3303485.ece|title=Shot Cuts|work=The Hindu|date=11 April 2012|accessdate=17 April 2012|location=Chennai, India}} while the climax action scenes were done by Kecha Khamphakdee's Jaika Stunt team.{{cite web|url=http://www.sify.com/movies/billa-2-stunt-master-praises-ajit-news-tamil-mesoqxgaeih.html?ref=false|title=Billa 2 stunt master praises Ajit!|publisher=Sify.com|date=18 April 2012|accessdate=28 April 2012}}{{cite news|author=V Lakshmi|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2012-06-29/news-interviews/32458399_1_chakri-toleti-stunt-action-sequences|title=When Billa got into action!|work=The Times of India|date=29 June 2012|accessdate=13 July 2012}} K. Rajasekhar choreographed the fight sequences in Hyderabad and Goa. Madhu Sudhanan, a [[VFX creative director]], said that [[visual effects|VFX]] had been used in action sequences, in "set extensions" and in sequences involving [[3-D film|3D]].{{cite news|author=K. Jeshi|url=http://www.thehindu.com/arts/cinema/article3588625.ece|title=Behind the Frames|work=The Hindu|date=30 June 2012|accessdate=13 July 2012|location=Chennai, India}} ==Soundtrack== {{main|Billa II (soundtrack)}} [[Yuvan Shankar Raja]], who had also worked on the score of ''[[Billa (2007 film)|Billa]]'' (2007), composed the soundtrack and score of ''Billa II'', becoming his fifth project starring [[Ajith Kumar]]. The album consists of six tracks, five songs and a [[theme music]] track.{{cite web|url=http://www.sify.com/movies/sony-music-snaps-billa-2-audio-news-tamil-mdglVqbcgaf.html|title=Sony Music snaps Billa 2 audio|publisher=Sify|date=6 March 2012|accessdate=28 March 2012}} The producer however confirmed that the film would feature a sixth song, not included in the soundtrack that was composed for a [[belly dance]] sequence.{{cite news|author=K. R. Manigandan|url=http://www.thehindu.com/life-and-style/metroplus/article3569004.ece|title=Shot Cuts: A weird friendship|work=The Hindu|date=25 June 2012|accessdate=13 July 2012|location=Chennai, India}}{{cite web|url=http://www.indiaglitz.com/channels/tamil/article/83267.html|title=New song in 'Billa 2!'|publisher=IndiaGlitz|date=28 June 2012|accessdate=13 July 2012}} [[Na. Muthukumar]] agreed to write the lyrics for the songs.{{cite web|url=http://newindianexpress.com/entertainment/interviews/article432929.ece|title='I compete only with myself'|work=The New Indian Express|location=India|date=9 June 2011|accessdate=16 September 2011}} In a departure from convention, the lyrics were penned first which were set to tunes later.{{cite web|url=http://www.Behindwoods.com/tamil-movie-news-1/apr-12-01/billa-2-thala-ajith-02-04-12.html|title=Billa 2 Is Full of Thrills|publisher=Behindwoods|date=2 April 2012|accessdate=17 April 2012}} The audio launch was initially to be released in mid-March 2012, but was then pushed to second week of April. Actor [[Rajinikanth]] was approached to unveil the soundtrack, with the team supposedly rescheduling the audio launch to suit Rajinikanth's dates, who had left for London for the filming of his film ''[[Kochadaiyaan]]''.{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2012-03-19/news-interviews/31210077_1_billa-ajith-rajini|title=Will Rajini attend Billa 2 audio launch?|work=The Times of India|date=19 March 2012|accessdate=28 March 2012}}{{cite web|url=http://www.indiaglitz.com/channels/tamil/article/79668.html|title=Rajini to unveil Ajith's 'Billa 2' music?|publisher=IndiaGlitz|date=|accessdate=28 March 2012}} The soundtrack was unveiled on 1 May 2012, coinciding with [[Ajith Kumar]]'s birthday.{{cite web|url=http://www.sify.com/movies/billa-2-audio-on-ajiths-birthday-news-tamil-metlCHjcabj.html?ref=false|title=Billa 2 audio, on Ajith's birthday?|publisher=Sify.com|date=19 April 2012|accessdate=28 April 2012}} [[Sony Music Entertainment]] that marketed the [[Mankatha (soundtrack)|album]] of Ajith Kumar's previous film ''[[Mankatha]]'', acquired the music rights of ''Billa II'' as well for an unprecedented sum after some weeks-long negotiations.{{cite web|url=http://www.sify.com/movies/sony-music-snaps-billa-2-audio-news-tamil-mdglVqbcgaf.html?ref=false|title=Sony Music snaps Billa 2 audio|publisher=Sify|date=6 March 2012|accessdate=28 March 2012}} In the week before the audio launch, Sony Music began releasing teasers of each of the songs every day and promoted them across social platforms.{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2012-04-25/news-interviews/31398664_1_billa-ajith-s-birthday-new-song|title=Billa 2 audio online! – Times of India|publisher=Timesofindia.indiatimes.com|date=|accessdate=28 April 2012}}{{cite web|url=http://www.radioandmusic.com/content/editorial/news/sony-music-goes-viral-promote-tamil-movie-billa-2-songs|title=Sony Music goes viral to promote Tamil movie 'Billa 2' songs | Editorial-News|publisher=Radioandmusic.com|date=14 January 2010|accessdate=28 April 2012}} The Telugu version of the soundtrack was released on 5 June 2012 at the Taj Deccan in [[Hyderabad, India|Hyderabad]].{{cite web|url=http://www.indiaglitz.com/channels/telugu/article/82681.html|title=David Billa audio released|publisher=IndiaGlitz|date=5 June 2012|accessdate=13 July 2012}} The soundtrack received positive response from critics{{cite web|title=BILLA 2 MUSIC REVIEW|url=http://www.behindwoods.com/tamil-music-reviews/review-1/may-12-01/billa-2-music-review.html|accessdate=11 July 2012}}{{cite web|title=Review: Billa 2 music is quite promising|url=http://www.rediff.com/movies/review/south-review-billa-2-music-is-quite-promising/20120504.htm|accessdate=11 July 2012}} and topped the charts.{{cite web|title=Billa 2 music sets charts on fire|url=http://www.123telugu.com/mnews/billa-2-music-sets-charts-on-fire.html|accessdate=11 July 2012}}{{cite news|title=Ajith Billa 2 Movie Grand Release in USA|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2012-07-08/news-interviews/32588285_1_grand-release-screens-makers|publisher=Times of India|accessdate=11 July 2012}}{{cite web|title=Billa 2 trailer to hit online today|url=http://www.behindwoods.com/tamil-movie-news-1/jul-12-01/billa-2-ajith-02-07-12.html|accessdate=11 July 2012}} ==Marketing== ''Billa II'' underwent an extensive marketing spree before its release.{{cite news|url=http://www.thehindu.com/arts/cinema/article3364380.ece|title=The don of summer|author=Nikhil Raghavan|date=28 April 2012|accessdate=14 July 2012|work=The Hindu|location=Chennai, India}} A first [[teaser poster]] displaying the new logo design was published in [[Diwali]] 2011,{{cite web|url=http://www.sify.com/movies/ajith-s-billa-2-logo-design-unveiled-news-tamil-lk5nb5ibbif.html?ref=false|title=Ajith's Billa 2 logo design unveiled|publisher=Sify|date=1 November 2011|accessdate=28 March 2012}} while the first posters depicting Ajith Kumar's look were released in January 2012 during the [[Pongal]] festival.{{cite web|url=http://www.sify.com/movies/billa-2-first-look-unveiled-news-tamil-mbpolSijdej.html?ref=false|title=Billa 2 first look unveiled|publisher=Sify|date=16 January 2012|accessdate=28 March 2012}} From late February onwards, further posters featuring Ajith were unveiled,{{cite web|url=http://www.sify.com/movies/ajith-s-billa-2-latest-update-news-tamil-mc3jo1cgafh.html|title=Ajith's Billa- 2 latest update|publisher=Sify|date=29 February 2012|accessdate=28 March 2012}} with one poster in late March portraying a young Ajith carrying a kerosene can on a boat that led to speculations over the character's origin.{{cite web|author=Anupama Subramanian|url=http://www.deccanchronicle.com/channels/showbiz/kollywood/young-ajith%E2%80%99s-first-look-billa-2-552|title=Young Ajith's first look from Billa 2|work=Deccan Chronicle|date=28 March 2012|accessdate=17 April 2012}} On 13 April 2012, a one-minute [[teaser trailer]] was uploaded to YouTube.{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2012-04-15/news-interviews/31344917_1_billa-ajith-teaser|title=Billa 2 teaser sets records|work=The Times of India|date=15 April 2012|accessdate=17 April 2012}} The teaser garnered over 500,000 views within the first three days of its release, setting a new record for Tamil films.{{cite web|url=http://www.sify.com/movies/billa-2-teaser-creates-a-sensation-news-tamil-meqk60eebhf.html|title=Billa 2 teaser creates a sensation|publisher=Sify|date=16 April 2012|accessdate=17 April 2012}} As part of the marketing, the makers planned to release a ''Billa 2'' calendar featuring the two lead actresses, Parvathy Omanakuttan and Bruna Abdulla; the stills were shot exclusively for the calendar in Goa.{{cite news|author=Lata Srinivasan|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2012-04-22/miss-india/31379326_1_billa-audio-release-parvathy-omanakuttan|title=Parvathy Omanakuttan sizzles in Billa 2 calendar|work=The Times of India|date=22 April 2012|accessdate=13 July 2012}} An event to launch the official theatrical trailer was planned to be held on 2 July at the [[Anna Centenary Library]] auditorium in [[Kotturpuram]], Chennai.{{cite web|url=http://www.sify.com/movies/ajith-s-billa-2-to-have-a-new-trailer-launch-news-tamil-mg3iopecfih.html?scategory=tamil|title=Ajith's 'Billa 2' to have a new trailer launch|publisher=Sify|date=29 June 2012|accessdate=13 July 2012}} The entire cast and crew along with Russian dancers were expected to attend the function, which was to be telecast on television later.{{cite news|author=Lata Srinivasan|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2012-07-03/news-interviews/32509437_1_trailer-ajith-venue|title=Billa II trailer launch cancelled; fans upset|work=The Times of India|date=3 July 2012|accessdate=13 July 2012}} The event was cancelled at short notice.{{cite web|url=http://www.sify.com/movies/billa-2-trailer-launch-cancelled-news-tamil-mhcjXWidhdi.html?ref=false|title=Billa 2 trailer launch cancelled|publisher=Sify|date=2 July 2012|accessdate=13 July 2012}} The trailer was however uploaded to YouTube the same day, gaining record views.{{cite web|url=http://ibnlive.in.com/news/billa-2-grand-trailer-launch-on-july-2/268433-71-180.html|title='Billa 2': Grand trailer launch on July 2|publisher=CNN-IBN|date=28 June 2012|accessdate=13 July 2012}}{{cite web|url=http://www.sify.com/movies/billa-2-new-trailer-rocks-news-tamil-mhdku4gjejg.html?ref=false|title=Billa 2 new trailer rocks!|publisher=Sify|date=3 July 2012|accessdate=13 July 2012}} Moreover, a promotional video featuring Ajith with composer Yuvan Shankar Raja was shot as well, but was not released either. ==Release== Billa 2 was released in 1110 theatres worldwide.{{citation needed|date=October 2014}} On first day Mayajaal Multiplex released Billa 2 in all screens and all shows – a total of 55 shows in 14 screens. The overseas distribution rights were sold for 53 million to the US-based company GK Media, the highest ever for an Ajith film. In March 2012, The [[Sun TV (India)|Sun TV]] bought the satellite rights for a record price,{{cite web|url=http://www.indiaglitz.com/channels/tamil/article/79307.html|title=Sun bags Ajith's 'Billa 2' satellite rights!|publisher=IndiaGlitz|date=|accessdate=28 March 2012}} with sources estimating the price at {{INR}}6 million.{{cite web|author=Prakash|url=http://entertainment.oneindia.in/tamil/news/2012/billa-2-satellite-rights-130312.html|title=Billa 2 satellite rights sold for Rs 6.25 cr|publisher=Oneindia.in|date=13 March 2012|accessdate=28 March 2012}} Three prominent production houses were reportedly trying to purchase the domestical theatrical rights then.{{cite web|url=http://www.sify.com/movies/billa-2-satellite-rights-sold-news-tamil-mdnro2fccdh.html|title=Billa 2 satellite rights sold|publisher=Sify|date=13 March 2012|accessdate=28 March 2012}} [[Venu Ravichandran]]'s [[Aascar Films]] eventually acquired the theatrical distribution rights of Tamil Nadu for {{INR}}260 million.{{cite web|author=22 April 2012 By Anupama Subramanian DC chennai|url=http://www.deccanchronicle.com/channels/showbiz/kollywood/%E2%80%98billa-2-worth-shot%E2%80%99-877|title='Billa 2 is worst film ever in Ajith's career |publisher=Deccan Chronicle|date=22 April 2012|accessdate=28 April 2012}}{{cite web|url=http://www.sify.com/movies/billa-2-records-rs-40-crore-sales-in-rights-news-tamil-meyjRKidiae.html|title=Billa 2 records Rs 3Crore sales in rights!|publisher=Sify.com|date=24 April 2012|accessdate=28 April 2012}} All the distribution rights of the film, except the Kerala and Hindi dubbing rights had been sold at a record price of more than {{INR}}400 million, making ''Billa II'' one of the top pre-release revenue generating films of all time in the Tamil film industry.{{cite web|url=http://www.rediff.com/movies/slide-show/slide-show-1-ajith-starrer-billa-2-sold-for-record-price/20120424.htm|title=Ajith-starrer Billa 2 sold at record price – Rediff.com Movies|publisher=Rediff.com|date=24 April 2012|accessdate=28 April 2012}} In early May 2012, the Kerala release rights were finally sold to Sagara Entertainment and Money Tree Entertainment for {{INR}}8million, likewise a new record for an Ajith film.{{cite web|url=http://www.sify.com/movies/billa-2-kerala-rights-sold-news-malayalam-mfdkE1fcaig.html?scategory=tamil|title=Billa 2- Kerala rights sold|publisher=Sify|date=3 March 2012|accessdate=13 July 2012}} ''Billa II'' received an adult rating ("A" certificate) from the [[Central Board of Film Certification]], due to its "high glamour quotient, violence and the mature content".{{cite web|title='Billa 2' gets 'A'! Release date & certificate rating to change?|url=http://www.indiaglitz.com/channels/tamil/article/82896.html|work=Indiaglitz|accessdate=16 June 2012}} In the UK, the film was issued an [[15 (British Board of Film Classification)|15 certificate]] by the [[British Board of Film Classification]] with an advice that it contained "very strong violence and revenge theme".{{cite web|url=http://www.bbfc.co.uk/AFF291235/|title=British Board of Film Classification|publisher=BBFC|accessdate=13 July 2012}} ''Billa II'' was initially planned to release on 13 April 2012, coinciding with [[Puthandu|Tamil New Year]], but the release was postponed to 1 May 2012, coinciding with Ajith Kumar's birthday,{{cite web|url=http://www.indiaglitz.com/channels/tamil/article/82273.html|title='Billa 2' likely to release on july 8|publisher=IndiaGlitz|accessdate=18 May 2012}} with the makers considering to bring forward the film by four days to release it on a Friday.{{cite web|url=http://ibnlive.in.com/news/billa-iis-title-song-to-be-released-this-week/235197-8-68.html|title=Ajith's Billa II's title song to be released in March 2012|work= CNN-IBN|date=|accessdate=28 March 2012}} However, the release became further delayed and was pushed to the second half of May 2012.{{cite web|url=http://www.sify.com/movies/billa-2-release-postponed-further-news-kollywood-mdkj7kfbedg.html?ref=false|title=Billa 2 release postponed further|publisher=Sify|date=10 March 2012|accessdate=28 March 2012}}{{cite web|url=http://www.indiaglitz.com/channels/tamil/article/79179.html|title='Billa 2' sees a delay in release?|publisher=IndiaGlitz|date=|accessdate=28 March 2012}} After considering the first four Fridays in June 2012 for the film's release,{{cite web|url=http://www.sify.com/movies/billa-2-re-recording-in-mumbai-news-tamil-mfvrmEjheeb.html?ref=false|title=Billa 2 re-recording in Mumbai?|publisher=Sify|date=21 March 2012|accessdate=13 July 2012}}{{cite web|url=http://www.sify.com/movies/ajith-s-billa-2-on-june-8-news-tamil-mfsh7Kgebfa.html?ref=false|title=Ajith's 'Billa- 2' on June 8?|publisher=Sify|date=18 March 2012|accessdate=13 July 2012}}{{cite web|url=http://www.sify.com/movies/the-biggies-are-coming-news-tamil-mgcmabddfjd.html?ref=false|title=The Biggies are coming!|publisher=Sify|date=2 June 2012|accessdate=13 July 2012}}{{cite web|url=http://www.behindwoods.com/tamil-movie-news-1/jun-12-03/billa-2-chakri-toleti-20-06-12.html|title=Billa 2 has unexpected twists: Chakri Toleti|publisher=behindwoods|date=20 June 2012|accessdate=20 June 2012}} the producer finally zeroed in on 13 July as the release date.{{cite news| url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2012-06-26/news-interviews/32424299_1_wide-angle-creations-billa-aascar-films|title= Billa 2 from July 13|date=26 June 2012 | work=The Times of India}} ''Billa 2'' was released across over 1,400 screens worldwide, making it one of the largest Tamil releases ever. The film was released simultaneously in the four southern states, Tamil Nadu, Karnataka, Andhra Pradesh and Kerala as well as in North India and international markets. In Tamil Nadu, it opened across 550 theatres,{{cite web|url=http://www.sify.com/movies/billa-2-confirmed-for-july-13-news-tamil-mgyqOzhdiid.html?scategory=tamil|title=Billa 2 confirmed for July 13|publisher=Sify|date=24 June 2012|accessdate=13 July 2012}} while a [[dubbing (filmmaking)|dubbed]] Telugu version of the film released in Andhra Pradesh as ''David Billa''.{{cite web|url=http://www.indiaglitz.com/channels/telugu/article/80871.html|title=Ajith's Billa2 will be dubbed into Telugu|publisher=IndiaGlitz|accessdate=17 April 2012}} In Kerala, the Tamil version was screened and Karnataka saw the release of both the versions.{{cite web|url=http://www.indiaglitz.com/channels/tamil/article/82857.html|title='Billa 2': Release plans|publisher=IndiaGlitz|date=13 June 2012|accessdate=13 July 2012}} The film was also released by Aanna Films in most of the major multiplexes in France with French subtitles;{{cite web|url=http://www.behindwoods.com/tamil-movie-news-1/jun-12-01/billa-2-ajith-05-06-12.html|title=Billa 2 goes to France|publisher=Behindwoods|date=5 June 2012|accessdate=5 June 2012}} in Malaysia, North India and the Gulf Nations, [[Malay language|Malay]], [[Hindi]] and [[Arabic]] subtitles were added to the film, respectively, while in other international markets, it was screened with English subtitles.{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2012-06-06/news-interviews/32078091_1_chakri-toleti-tinsel-town-subtitles|title=Billa 2 in multiple languages|publisher=Times of India|date=9 June 2012|accessdate=9 June 2012}} ===Reception=== Karthik Subramanian of ''[[The Hindu]]'' said, "Where the movie lacks in substance, it does try to score with technical aspects. The camerawork by R. D. Rajasekhar, background score by Yuvan Shankar Raja and editing by [[Suresh Urs]] are superlative for the most part", and that the film "does live up to the hype".{{cite news|author=Karthik Subramanian |url=http://www.thehindu.com/arts/cinema/article3639256.ece |title=Arts / Cinema : Does 'Billa II' beckon? |publisher=The Hindu |date=14 July 2012 |accessdate=9 November 2012 |location=Chennai, India}} [[MSN|MSN India]] said "''Billa 2'' would be an interesting film for ajith fans&watchable film for general audience"{{cite web|author=Ians |url=http://entertainment.in.msn.com/southcinema/reviews/review-billa-2 |title=Review: 'Billa 2' – Reviews |publisher=MSN India Entertainment |date=16 July 2012 |accessdate=15 May 2013}} Meena Iyer of ''[[The Times of India]]'' recommended it with a 3 star rating, "If you're a Ajith fan—''Billa 2'' is a must. If you're an action aficionado, it's a treat. If you're neither, then don't bother."{{cite news|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/regional/tamil/movie-reviews/Billa-2/movie-review/14864866.cms |title=Billa 2 movie review: Wallpaper, Story, Trailer at Times of India |publisher=Timesofindia.indiatimes.com |date= |accessdate=9 November 2012}} Indiaglitz called it as a slick entertainer running for just 129 minutes.{{cite web|url=http://www.indiaglitz.com/channels/tamil/review/12833.html |title=Billa II Tamil Movie Review – cinema preview stills gallery trailer video clips showtimes |publisher=IndiaGlitz |date=13 July 2012 |accessdate=9 November 2012}} Prathibha Parameswaran of [[IBN Live]] said, "If you liked ''[[Billa 2007|Billa]]'' and ''[[Mankatha]]'', and expected as much from the prequel, it falls well short of expectations." and further wrote, "watch it only for Thala."{{cite web|url=http://ibnlive.in.com/news/review-watch-sluggish-billa-2-only-for-ajith/271114-71-178.html |title=Tamil Review: 'Billa 2' lacks pace, but watch it for Ajith if you must- Tamil Reviews- IBNLive |publisher=Ibnlive.in.com |date=13 July 2012 |accessdate=9 November 2012}} Anupama Subramanian of [[Deccan Chronicle]] rated the film 3 out of 5 stars and said, "The film works to a great extent because of the sheer screen presence of a star called Ajith Kumar. After all, it is his film all the way!"{{cite web|author=Anupama Subramanian |url=http://www.deccanchronicle.com/channels/showbiz/movie-reviews/billa-2-review-no-message-behind-violence-749 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120726114209/http://www.deccanchronicle.com/channels/showbiz/movie-reviews/billa-2-review-no-message-behind-violence-749 |archivedate=26 July 2012 |title=Billa 2 review: No message behind the violence |publisher=Deccan Chronicle |date=15 July 2012 |accessdate=9 November 2012}} ===Box office=== ====India==== In the domestic market, ''Billa II'' had a great opening with 95% occupancy in single screens and multiplexes. The film raked in close to {{INR}}40 crore worldwide in its opening three-day weekend. In the opening week, it grossed around {{INR}}2.79 crore at the Chennai box office and after 5 weeks, it amounted to {{INR}}7.79 crore after tax deduction.{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2012-07-16/news-interviews/32697136_1_billa-bigger-risk-film-industry |title=Billa 2 collection report |publisher=The Times of India |date=16 July 2012 |accessdate=15 May 2013}}{{cite web|url=http://indiatoday.intoday.in/story/ajith-kumars-billa-2/1/208645.html |title=Ajith Kumar's Billa 2 continues to get thumpdown response at box office : Bollywood, News – India Today |publisher=Indiatoday.intoday.in |date=17 July 2012 |accessdate=9 November 2012}}{{cite web|url=http://behindwoods.com/tamil-movies/billa-2/billa-2-box-office-aug-12.html |title=Billa 2 box office collection |publisher=Behindwoods.com |date= |accessdate=15 May 2013}} The movie was one of the top grosser in box office. ====Overseas==== In Malaysia, ''Billa II'' collected USD$348,000{{cite web|url=http://www.boxofficemojo.com/intl/malaysia/yearly/?yr=2012&p=.htm|title=2012 Malaysia Yearly Box Office Results|publisher=|accessdate=30 September 2016}} The film grossed $78,000 in the UK{{cite web|url=http://www.boxofficemojo.com/movies/intl/?page=&country=UK&wk=2012W29&id=_fBILLA201|title=Billa 2|publisher=|accessdate=30 September 2016}} and approximately $20,000 in Australia.{{cite web|url=http://www.boxofficemojo.com/movies/intl/?page=&country=AU&wk=2012W29&id=_fBILLA201|title=Billa 2|publisher=|accessdate=30 September 2016}} ==References== {{reflist|30em}} ==External links== * {{IMDb title|id=1891755}} * {{rotten-tomatoes|id=billa_2|title=Billa II}} {{Don film series|state=expanded}} {{Chakri Toleti}} {{Salim-Javed}} [[Category:Indian gangster films]] [[Category:2012 films]] [[Category:2010s action films]] [[Category:2010s prequel films]] [[Category:Indian action films]] [[Category:Indian films]] [[Category:Films shot in Puducherry]] [[Category:Films featuring an item number]] [[Category:Films about organised crime in India]] [[Category:Films shot in Goa]] [[Category:Films shot in Andhra Pradesh]] [[Category:Films shot in Tbilisi]] [[Category:Films shot in Georgia (country)]] [[Category:Films scored by Yuvan Shankar Raja]] [[Category:2010s Tamil-language films]] [[Category:Prequel films]] [[Category:Indian crime films]] [[Category:Tamil-language films dubbed in Telugu]]
